Definition: to carry something to another place
Example: Make sure you bring your umbrella

Definition: earlier in time
Example: Brush your teeth before you go to bed.

Definition: having little weight
Example: Your pencil case is very light. I think it's empty.
Example_Korean: 너의 필통은 매우 가벼워. 비어있는 것 같아.

Definition: to hold something while moving
Example: Can you carry all those books?
Example_Korean: 그 모든 책들을 들고 갈 수 있어?

Definition: quickly and unexpectedly
Example: Suddenly it started to rain.

Definition: on all sides
Example: Let's walk around the park.

Definition: to leave the ground fast
Example: When it is ready the rocket will blast off.

Definition: surprised and slightly frightened
Example: She gave a startle look.

Definition: to notice or recognize a difference between people or things
Definition_Korean: 사람이나 사물 간의 차이를 알아차리거나 인식하다
Example: It's hard to distinguish twins.

Definition: to divide things or people into groups according to their type
Definition_Korean: 유형에 따라 사물이나 사람을 그룹으로 나누다
Example: We can classify animals by their size or where they live.
Example_Korean: 크기나 서식지에 따라 동물을 분류할 수 있다.

Definition: tiny dry pieces of dirt
Example: There's a lot of dust on this TV.

Definition: the force that pulls us to the ground
Example: Gravity keeps us from flying in the sky.
Example_Korean: 중력이 우리가 하늘로 날아가지 않게 한다.

Definition: the planet we live on
Example: Earth is the third planet from the sun.

Definition: having to do with the moon
Example: The lunar new year is in February.

Definition: something that moves from one place to another
Definition_Korean: 한 장소에서 다른 장소로 움직이는 것
Example: The astronauts use a rover to explore the moon.
Example_Korean: 우주비행사들은 달을 탐사하기 위해 탐사선을 사용한다.

Definition: the mark a person or an animal leaves when walking
Definition_Korean: 사람이나 동물이 걸을 때 남기는 자국
Example: I saw some animal footprints in the snow.

Definition: a person who goes into space
Example: An astronaut must train very hard.

Definition: the things you need to do something
Example: I brought some baseball equipment so we can play.
Example_Korean: 우리가 놀 수 있도록 야구 장비를 가져왔다.

Definition: whole or complete with nothing missing
Example: I ate the entire cake.

Definition: arrange them a certain way
Example: I organize my books by color.

Definition: Certain
Example: Are you sure you want to go in there?

Definition: a piece of planned work or an activity
Example: We are working on a science project.

Definition: Relating to
Example: This book is about the four seasons.

Definition: perhaps; not sure
Example: Maybe we should wait until the rain stops.
Example_Korean: 비가 그칠 때까지 기다리는 게 좋을 것 같다.

Definition: the way that something is built arranged or organized
Example: The structure of the building is very strong.

Definition: to stop working
Example: My computer is old. I think it will break down soon.
Example_Korean: 내 컴퓨터는 오래됐다. 곧 고장날 것 같다.

Definition: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
Example: Only a few cookies remain on the plate.

Definition: carefully considering things
Example: She gave me a thoughtful gift.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 나에게 사려 깊은 선물을 주었다.

Definition: to make a large jump
Example: The cat leaped over the wall.

Definition: to make (something) wider or longer by pulling it
Example: I stretch my arms every morning.

Definition: If you are stubborn that means you don't change your mind easily
Definition_Korean: 고집스럽다는 것은 쉽게 마음을 바꾸지 않는다는 뜻
Example: My sister is stubborn. She won't let me watch the TV.
Example_Korean: 내 여동생은 고집이 세다. 나에게 TV를 보게 해주지 않는다.

Definition: something that opens up and helps you float to the ground
Definition_Korean: 펼쳐져서 땅으로 떠내려가는 것을 도와주는 것
Example: Don't go skydiving without a parachute!

Definition: to say something in a strong way
Example: Watch out he exclaimed!

Definition: rocks sand or coral that is close to the surface of the sea or ocean
Definition_Korean: 바다나 대양의 표면 가까이에 있는 바위 모래 또는 산호
Example: Sailors need to know where the reef is so they don't hit it.
Example_Korean: 선원들은 암초가 어디 있는지 알아야 부딪히지 않는다.

Definition: like a cloud that is close to the ground
Example: I can't see in this fog.
Example_Korean: 이 안개 속에서는 볼 수 없다.

Definition: a sailor who attacks other boats
Example: I'm wearing a pirate costume for Halloween.
Example_Korean: 나는 할로윈에 해적 의상을 입고 있다.

Definition: a person who goes somewhere no one has gone before
Definition_Korean: 아무도 가본 적 없는 곳에 가는 사람
Example: When I went into that cave I felt like an explorer.
Example_Korean: 그 동굴에 들어갔을 때 나는 탐험가가 된 기분이었다.

Definition: the things you need to bring with you
Example: Did you bring the supplies we need?

Definition: interested in learning about people or things around you
Definition_Korean: 주변 사람이나 사물에 대해 배우는 것에 관심이 있는
Example: The child was curious about the new toy.
Example_Korean: 그 아이는 새 장난감에 대해 호기심이 있었다.

Definition: to (cause something to) get better
Example: He worked hard to improve his grades.
Example_Korean: 그는 성적을 향상시키기 위해 열심히 공부했다.

Definition: happy and satisfied
Example: He felt contented after eating his favorite pizza.
Example_Korean: 그는 좋아하는 피자를 먹고 나서 만족감을 느꼈다.

Definition: the soil we grow things in and walk on
Example: The ground is hard and dry here.

Definition: now and then; at times
Example: Sometimes we go to my grandmother's house on Sundays.
Example_Korean: 때때로 우리는 일요일에 할머니 집에 간다.

Definition: in a lower place than
Example: There's a mouse under the table.

Definition: more than one thing that is close
Example: These candies are better than those ones.
Example_Korean: 이 사탕들이 저 사탕들보다 더 좋다.

Definition: in a straight line; directly
Example: Fruit that comes right from the tree tastes the best.
Example_Korean: 나무에서 바로 딴 과일이 가장 맛있다.

Definition: to break ground or grind something
Example: I crushed the can by stepping on it.

Definition: a plant or part of a plant that you can eat
Definition_Korean: 먹을 수 있는 식물이나 식물의 일부
Example: Potatoes are my favorite vegetables.

Definition: to make (something) more difficult or less simple
Definition_Korean: 더 어렵게 하거나 덜 간단하게 만들다
Example: The new rules will complicate the game.
Example_Korean: 새로운 규칙들이 게임을 복잡하게 만들 것이다.

Definition: an object made to do a certain job
Definition_Korean: 특정한 일을 하기 위해 만들어진 물건
Example: I use my device to watch videos.
Example_Korean: 나는 비디오를 보기 위해 기기를 사용한다.

Definition: a small dry fruit of a cereal grass such as wheat
Definition_Korean: 밀과 같은 곡초의 작고 마른 열매
Example: Wheat is a grain. It is used to make bread.

Definition: powder used for baking
Example: Can you go to the store and get some flour?
Example_Korean: 가게에 가서 밀가루를 좀 사올 수 있니?

Definition: to break open with a short sharp explosive sound
Example: If you blow up your balloon too big it will pop.
Example_Korean: 풍선을 너무 크게 불면 터질 것이다.

Definition: a sweet liquid in flowers
Example: Bees collect the nectar from flowers.

Definition: where a group of bees live
Example: There's a bee hive in that tree over there.

Definition: the liquid that comes from a tree
Example: Maple syrup is made from tree sap.

Definition: to fall in small amounts
Example: The water drips into the sink.

Definition: changing one thing for another
Example: Do you want to trade cards with me?

Definition: to cut something with an ax
Example: Can you chop some wood for the fire?
Example_Korean: 불을 위해 나무를 좀 잘라줄 수 있니?

Definition: to think of or create (something that is not real) in your mind
Example: Can you imagine living on the moon?
Example_Korean: 달에 사는 것을 상상할 수 있니?

Definition: of better quality
Example: That was a great movie!

Definition: to have as plan or purposes
Example: I intend to study hard for the exam.
Example_Korean: 나는 시험을 위해 열심히 공부할 의도이다.

Definition: shortly; in the near future
Example: I have to go home soon.

Definition: what you do to show that something is funny
Definition_Korean: 무언가 재미있다는 것을 보여주기 위해 하는 것
Example: My uncle always makes me laugh.
Example_Korean: 내 삼촌은 항상 나를 웃게 만든다.

Definition: finished; completed
Example: I have done all my homework.

Definition: plants that are grown for eating
Example: What kind of crops does this farm grow?
Example_Korean: 이 농장은 어떤 종류의 작물을 기르나요?

Definition: to move quickly by making small jumps
Example: A rabbit hops faster than a frog.

Definition: a suggestion or plan for doing something
Example: She has a great idea for the project.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 그 프로젝트에 대한 좋은 아이디어가 있다.

Definition: not normal or usual
Example: It's unusual to see snow in April.

Definition: level of sound whether loud or soft
Example: Turn down the volume on the TV.

Definition: closing and opening one eye very quickly
Definition_Korean: 한쪽 눈을 매우 빠르게 감았다 뜨다
Example: He smiled and gave me a wink
Example_Korean: 그는 미소를 지으며 나에게 윙크를 했다.

Definition: a place where books are kept
Example: I need to go to the library to read a book.
Example_Korean: 나는 책을 읽기 위해 도서관에 가야 한다.

Definition: to breath sharply because of shock or surprise
Example: I was so surprised that I gasped.

Definition: Many
Example: There are lots of insects in my yard.

Definition: to make things different
Example: I need to change my clothes because these are dirty.

Definition: the time before now
Example: In the past they didn't have the internet.

Definition: without delay; at once; now
Example: We have to leave right away!

Definition: extremely good
Example: The view from the top of the mountain was marvelous.

Definition: something that flies in space
Example: I want to fly in a rocket someday.

Definition: a general feeling or understanding
Example: He has a good sense of balance when he plays soccer.
Example_Korean: 그는 축구를 할 때 좋은 균형감각을 가지고 있다.

Definition: to watch carefully
Example: I like to observe the birds in the park
Example_Korean: 나는 공원에서 새들을 관찰하는 것을 좋아한다.

Definition: greater in number
Example: I have more homework than you.

Definition: to make steady by keeping weight equal on all sides
Definition_Korean: 모든 면에서 무게를 균등하게 유지하여 안정시키다
Example: She kept her balance while riding the bike.

Definition: one of the parts that form something
Example: This section of the book is about animals.
Example_Korean: 책의 이 부분은 동물에 관한 것이다.

Definition: to move a little bit from one place to another
Definition_Korean: 한 곳에서 다른 곳으로 조금 움직이다
Example: The bags sometimes shift in an airplane.

Definition: a pole used for fishing
Example: This is my lucky fishing rod. I catch a lot of fish with it.
Example_Korean: 이것은 내 행운의 낚싯대다. 이것으로 많은 물고기를 잡는다.

Definition: to make someone stop giving their attention to something
Definition_Korean: 누군가가 무언가에 주의를 기울이는 것을 멈추게 하다
Example: The loud music distracted the students during the test.
Example_Korean: 시끄러운 음악이 시험 중에 학생들을 방해했다.

Definition: worried and anxious
Example: He was nervous about meeting new people.
Example_Korean: 그는 새로운 사람들을 만나는 것에 대해 긴장했다.

Definition: to move or climb over something quickly
Example: They scrambled up the hill.

Definition: making a very high sound
Example: The door made a squeaky sound when it opened.
Example_Korean: 문이 열릴 때 삐걱거리는 소리를 냈다.

Definition: to move suddenly
Example: If your fishing rod starts to twitch you have a fish.
Example_Korean: 낚싯대가 갑자기 움직이기 시작하면 물고기가 걸린 것이다.

Definition: a small river
Example: Let's jump in the stream to cool off.

Definition: to run
Example: Let's dash to get out of the rain!

Definition: a piece of a trunk of a fallen tree
Example: There are a lot of ants on that log.

Definition: the hard covering of a turtle or snail
Example: The turtle went into its shell.

Definition: one of the three main times for eating in a day
Definition_Korean: 하루에 세 번 먹는 주요 식사 중 하나
Example: I haven't had a meal yet today.
Example_Korean: 나는 오늘 아직 식사를 하지 않았다.

Definition: something said to make other people laugh
Definition_Korean: 다른 사람들을 웃게 하기 위해 말하는 것
Example: Do you know any good jokes?

Definition: to stick up in the air
Example: My dog's ears perk up when we give his food.
Example_Korean: 우리가 먹이를 줄 때 개의 귀가 쫑긋 선다.

Definition: extremely big
Example: The desert is vast and empty.

Definition: having no doubt or knowing exactly that something is true
Definition_Korean: 의심이 없거나 무언가가 사실임을 정확히 아는
Example: I am certain I left my keys on the table.
Example_Korean: 나는 열쇠를 테이블에 두고 왔다고 확신한다.

Definition: to say what happened
Example: I told you I was going to be late.

Definition: to have a disagreement between 2 or more people
Definition_Korean: 2명 이상의 사람들 사이에 의견 불일치가 있다
Example: They had a conflict over the rules of the game.
Example_Korean: 그들은 게임 규칙에 대해 갈등이 있었다.

Definition: to some degree; mostly
Example: He got a pretty good score on the test.
Example_Korean: 그는 시험에서 꽤 좋은 점수를 받았다.

Definition: to use your brain
Example: I will have to think about it.

Definition: to perceive an image with your eyes
Example: I saw that new movie yesterday.
Example_Korean: 나는 어제 그 새 영화를 봤다.

Definition: the land that is around a house
Example: Let's go play in the yard!

Definition: treating someone in a way that is right
Example: The referee made a fair call during the game.
Example_Korean: 심판은 게임 중에 공정한 판정을 내렸다.

Definition: a fight that uses words
Example: They had an argument about which movie to watch.
Example_Korean: 그들은 어떤 영화를 볼지에 대해 논쟁했다.

Definition: the possibility of something bad happening
Example: There is a risk of falling if you climb too high.
Example_Korean: 너무 높이 올라가면 떨어질 위험이 있다.

Definition: to move a little bit from one place to another
Definition_Korean: 한 곳에서 다른 곳으로 조금 움직이다
Example: The bags sometimes shift in an airplane.

Definition: to be made happy
Example: My mom was pleased with my test score.
Example_Korean: 내 엄마는 내 시험 점수에 만족했다.

Definition: very bad; terrible
Example: I had an awful day.

Definition: to hang loosely
Example: The branches drooped from all the snow.

Definition: the thick main part of a tree
Example: There's a hole in the trunk of that tree.

Definition: a way of bringing something to someone
Example: I have a delivery for Mr. Smith

Definition: to get something in exchange for money
Example: My mom bought me some new shoes for school.
Example_Korean: 엄마는 학교를 위해 새 신발을 사주셨다.

Definition: complete; all the parts
Example: He put a whole donut in his mouth.

Definition: something you use to clean your teeth
Example: This new toothpaste tastes awful!

Definition: to ask for something forcefully
Example: The teacher demanded silence during the test
Example_Korean: 선생님은 시험 중에 조용히 하라고 요구했다.

Definition: a dangerous or serious situation
Example: The fireman rushed to the emergency.

Definition: to gain knowledge through experience or study
Example: I am learning to play the piano.
Example_Korean: 나는 피아노 치는 것을 배우고 있다.

Definition: to start
Example: The class begins at 9:00 every day.

Definition: up to the that time
Example: Let's keep playing until it gets dark

Definition: in an early stage of life
Example: You're too young to go on this ride.
Example_Korean: 너는 이 놀이기구를 타기에는 너무 어리다.

Definition: to come or go after
Example: I will follow you in my car.

Definition: twelve months
Example: How many years have you played soccer?

Definition: the hard mouth part of a bird
Example: That bird uses its beak to open the nuts.
Example_Korean: 그 새는 견과류를 열기 위해 부리를 사용한다.

Definition: to make someone want to do something
Example: The story of her success inspired me to keep trying.
Example_Korean: 그녀의 성공 이야기가 나에게 계속 노력하라는 영감을 주었다.

Definition: a feeling of admiring someone or something that is good
Example: It's important to respect your friends.

Definition: a choice that you make after thinking about something
Definition_Korean: 무언가에 대해 생각한 후 내리는 선택
Example: She made a decision to go to the park.

Definition: the rough outer covering of a tree
Example: Look this tree has white bark!
Example_Korean: 이 나무는 하얀 껍질을 가지고 있다 봐!

Definition: the round bump on the back of a camel
Example: That camel has a huge hump!
Example_Korean: 그 낙타는 거대한 혹을 가지고 있다!

Definition: inside body part that helps you keep warm and stores food
Definition_Korean: 몸을 따뜻하게 유지하고 음식을 저장하는 내부 신체 부위
Example: I'm on a diet I need to lose some fat.
Example_Korean: 다이어트 중이라 지방을 좀 빼야 한다.

Definition: a dry sandy place with very little rain
Definition_Korean: 비가 거의 내리지 않는 마른 모래 장소
Example: I wouldn't want to go to the desert. It's too hot.
Example_Korean: 사막에는 가고 싶지 않다. 너무 덥다.

Definition: a group of animals that stay together
Example: We saw a herd of horses on the way here.
Example_Korean: 여기 오는 길에 말 떼를 봤다.

Definition: a young bear wolf or lion
Example: Don't go near the cubs the mother will get angry!
Example_Korean: 새끼들에게 가까이 가지 마라 어미가 화낼 것이다!

Definition: a young duck
Example: Maybe a duckling will come out of this egg.

Definition: the amount of space between two places
Example: The distance from my house to school is 2 kilometers

Definition: quickly or immediately
Example: The rabbit ran swiftly across the field.

Definition: to agree to take something
Example: She accepted the invitation to the party.

Definition: the place where you live
Example: Let's go to your house and play.

Definition: in a line matching the direction of something
Example: I like to walk along the river.
Example_Korean: 나는 강을 따라 걷는 것을 좋아한다.

Definition: many times
Example: I often visit my grandparents.

Definition: one more time
Example: I've been there but I want to go again.
Example_Korean: 나는 거기에 가본 적이 있지만 다시 가고 싶다.

Definition: not anything
Example: There's nothing to do around here.
Example_Korean: 여기 주변에는 할 일이 아무것도 없다.

Definition: to start
Example: We were almost home when it began raining.
Example_Korean: 비가 내리기 시작했을 때 우리는 거의 집에 도착했다.

Definition: to make a sound by pushing air through your teeth or lips
Definition_Korean: 이나 입술로 공기를 밀어내며 소리를 내다
Example: He would always whistle a happy tune.
Example_Korean: 그는 항상 행복한 멜로디를 휘파람으로 불었다.

Definition: in a direct line
Example: When I finish school I go straight home.
Example_Korean: 학교가 끝나면 나는 바로 집에 간다.

Definition: a set of events or actions that happen again and again in the same order
Definition_Korean: 같은 순서로 반복해서 일어나는 사건이나 행동의 집합
Example: The water cycle is very important for the Earth.

Definition: to say that an event or action will happen in the future
Definition_Korean: 미래에 사건이나 행동이 일어날 것이라고 말하다
Example: I can predict that it will rain tomorrow
Example_Korean: 나는 내일 비가 올 것이라고 예측할 수 있다.

Definition: something used to write or color usually on a blackboard
Definition_Korean: 칠판에 글을 쓰거나 색칠하는데 사용되는 것
Example: The teacher dropped the chalk.

Definition: to push air out of your mouth
Example: I blew out all the candles.

Definition: the part of your face between your nose and ear
Example: My mom kisses my cheek before I go to bed.
Example_Korean: 잠자리에 들기 전에 엄마가 내 뺨에 키스해준다.

Definition: a place where something is split or broken
Example: There's a crack in this glass.

Definition: having the ability to make new and original ideas
Definition_Korean: 새롭고 독창적인 아이디어를 만드는 능력을 가진
Example: She is very creative and loves drawing.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 매우 창조적이고 그림 그리기를 좋아한다.

Definition: to move quickly
Example: We scrambled home because it started raining.
Example_Korean: 비가 내리기 시작해서 우리는 재빨리 집으로 갔다.

Definition: a place where boats can stop and load or unload
Definition_Korean: 배가 멈춰서 짐을 싣거나 내릴 수 있는 곳
Example: That boat left the port an hour ago.
Example_Korean: 그 배는 한 시간 전에 항구를 떠났다.

Definition: extremely cold
Example: The frigid wind made it hard to walk outside.
Example_Korean: 매서운 바람이 밖으로 걷기 어렵게 만들었다.

Definition: very hot
Example: The scorching sun made everyone seek shade.
Example_Korean: 찌는 듯한 태양이 모든 사람들을 그늘을 찾게 만들었다.

Definition: an area of land that has its own government army
Definition_Korean: 자체 정부와 군대를 가진 토지 지역
Example: Korea is my country.

Definition: prepared or available for action
Example: Are you ready to go?

Definition: to bring (things or people) together into a group
Example: We gathered flowers from the garden

Definition: a variety; a sort
Example: What kind of bike do you have?

Definition: too; in addition
Example: You can also use it for camping.

Definition: the colorful part of some plants
Example: That is a beautiful flower.

Definition: a comfortable amount of heat
Example: Eat your dinner while it's still warm!

Definition: an insect shaped like a worm
Example: A caterpillar eats leaves.

Definition: to get bigger
Example: I grew 10 centimeters this year.

Definition: a serious attempt to do something
Example: She put a lot of effort into her school project.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 학교 프로젝트에 많은 노력을 쏟았다.

Definition: a belief principle or way of acting that people in a particular society or group
Definition_Korean: 특정 사회나 그룹의 사람들이 가진 믿음 원칙 또는 행동 방식
Example: It is a tradition to eat kimchi on New Year's Day.
Example_Korean: 새해 첫날에 김치를 먹는 것은 전통이다.

Definition: to hold tightly to something
Example: Hang on to something this is a bumpy road.

Definition: a small amount of liquid
Example: There's a drop of paint on the floor.

Definition: to bite and grind with the teeth
Example: You should chew your food before you swallow it!

Definition: to eat noisily
Example: Do you have to munch so loudly?

Definition: a stage that butterflies go through
Example: A butterfly will soon come out of this chrysalis.
Example_Korean: 나비가 곧 이 번데기에서 나올 것이다.

Definition: very old having lived or existed for a very long time
Example: The ancient temple is over 1000 years old.

Definition: information; a hint
Example: Can you give me a clue on this test question?
Example_Korean: 이 시험 문제에 대한 단서를 줄 수 있니?

Definition: a change of position
Example: The movement of the clock hands is steady.

Definition: not easy or simple
Example: The math problem was very difficult.

Definition: not anyone
Example: Nobody was at the park when I arrived.
Example_Korean: 내가 도착했을 때 공원에는 아무도 없었다.

Definition: a big place where many people live and work
Definition_Korean: 많은 사람들이 살고 일하는 큰 곳
Example: I want to move to the big city.

Definition: Myself is used when you're referring to you
Example: I was looking at myself in the mirror.
Example_Korean: 나는 거울 속의 내 자신을 보고 있었다.

Definition: to show something or a collection of things in an organized way for people to see
Definition_Korean: 사람들이 볼 수 있도록 조직적인 방법으로 무언가나 사물들의 모음을 보여주다
Example: She displayed her artwork at the school exhibition.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 학교 전시회에서 자신의 작품을 전시했다.

Definition: a feeling that you respect yourself
Example: He felt pride when he finished the race.
Example_Korean: 그가 경주를 마쳤을 때 자부심을 느꼈다.

Definition: a group that usually has parents and children
Example: There are six people in my family

Definition: a group of people who work together
Example: That crew set up the tents very quickly.
Example_Korean: 그 팀이 텐트를 매우 빠르게 설치했다.

Definition: something you use to carry things
Example: I left my pail at the beach.

Definition: to make or draw plans for something
Example: She will design a new logo for the company
Example_Korean: 그녀는 회사를 위한 새 로고를 설계할 것이다.

Definition: why you do something or why something exists
Definition_Korean: 무언가를 하는 이유나 무언가가 존재하는 이유
Example: The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the project.

Definition: to speak act or be present officially for another person or people
Definition_Korean: 다른 사람이나 사람들을 위해 공식적으로 말하거나 행동하거나 참석하다
Example: She will represent our school in the competition.
Example_Korean: 그녀는 경연에서 우리 학교를 대표할 것이다.

Definition: to come to a stop
Example: When we pull up to your house I will call you.

Definition: a group of people living in one country
Example: Korea is a nation with a rich history.

Definition: to join together as a group
Example: The team united to win the championship.

Definition: to give something back
Example: He repaid us for helping with ice cream.
Example_Korean: 그는 도움에 대한 보답으로 아이스크림을 사줬다.

Definition: the area around your home
Example: What is your neighborhood like?

Definition: We want a celebration with people in costumes and music that moves through the streets to see the pageant at the park
Definition_Korean: 의상을 입고 음악과 함께 거리를 행진하여 공원의 축제를 보는 축하 행사
Example: This is the best parade I've ever seen!

Definition: to welcome someone in a friendly way
Example: Our class greeted the new student.

Definition: a kind of box used for packing things
Example: Can you bring down the crate from the attic?

Definition: to take out of a box or suitcase
Example: I still have to unpack my bags from my trip.
Example_Korean: 여행에서 가져온 가방의 짐을 아직 풀어야 한다.

Definition: any object happening or matter
Example: Is there anything to drink?
